00025 #ifndef __FrameListener_H__
00026 #define __FrameListener_H__
00027 
00028 
00029 #include "OgrePrerequisites.h"
00030 
00031 namespace Ogre {
00032 
00035     struct FrameEvent
00036     {
00044         Real timeSinceLastEvent;
00051         Real timeSinceLastFrame;
00052     };
00053 
00054 
00073     class _OgreExport FrameListener
00074     {
00075         /*
00076         Note that this could have been an abstract class, but I made
00077         the explicit choice not to do this, because I wanted to give
00078         people the option of only implementing the methods they wanted,
00079         rather than having to create 'do nothing' implementations for
00080         those they weren't interested in. As such this class follows
00081         the 'Adapter' classes in Java rather than pure interfaces.
00082         */
00083     public:
00089         virtual bool frameStarted(const FrameEvent& evt) { return true; }
00095         virtual bool frameEnded(const FrameEvent& evt) { return true; }
00096 
00097         virtual ~FrameListener() {}
00098         
00099     };
00100 }
00101 
00102 #endif
